page.title: 02BUILDINGS-LUMLEY CASTLE.
page.content: Set in acres of lovely woods, medieval Lumley Castle, owned and leased by the Earl of Scarborough,has been converted into an International Class hotel with luxurious amenities. In 1389 the manor house was licensed to be converted to a castle for Ralph, Lord Lumley. The first "real" modernization took place around 1721 by the architect Vanbrugh. In the 19th century the castle was deserted.In the 20th it was restored and refurnished for the family,then it became a college of Durham and finally a hotel. You can enjoy the atmosphere of a medieval banquet in the Baron's Hall, which is dominated by a giant stone fireplace. There are Conference Rooms & rooms for private parties such as the elegant Garter Room. Discos are held in the dungeons. One suite has a secret bathroom through the wardrobe! {E.Mason. E.Lindsay. S.Cullen. K.Hood.
